snippet.title: Sing, dance and live life to the full at concert
snippet.content: CITTAMANI Hospice at Palmwoods will benefit from a musical afternoon at Kawana Community Hall on Saturday, August 19, at 2pm. The Sunshine Coast Concert Band, directed by Ken Chadwick, will present its Sing and Dance Concert. Guest singers will be Dave Stygall and Tanya McFadyen with The Merryatric Players as a special treat. All proceeds are in aid of Cittamani, which provides professional palliative care to people who are dying and their families. The hospice offers compassionate care and honours clients' individual choices. Its aim is to provide the highest-quality service from the time of diagnosis through to the bereavement period. The belief is that this service is best provided in a healthy and supportive community where death, dying and bereavement are openly discussed and accepted. So head along to the hall in Nanyima St, Buddina, to support this worthwhile cause. Tickets at the door are $15, which includes afternoon tea. Email sunshinecoastconcertband@ gmail.com for more information. Check out the band's website at www.sccb.org.au and Facebook page. 61-year-old dead after collision with four-wheel-drive How a positive approach is defying a cancer death sentence One Nation's bid to redirect funding has fallen on deaf ears LOCAL government, community and business groups took up challenge.
